Articles.Content:
Hallo

i am waiting for the new KSP Weekly

is it coming or i mist any ting ?
The person that did it isn't around here any more, so I'm not sure if we'll get a KSP weekly..
Hi there Spooks, it's coming - be patient
It's coming, it usually is like near the end of the day for me
It comes at 1:00am for me, so in about...12 hours and 30 minutes.

However if you're seeking news...

fresh off their twitter page. .22 has entered the testing phase.

However if you're seeking news...

fresh off their twitter page. .22 has entered the testing phase.

*quickly organizes a Minmus base so that I wont have to send a Kerbal up after updating*

Time for SCIENCE!
thank all for the info cant wait

*quickly organizes a Minmus base so that I wont have to send a Kerbal up after updating*

Time for SCIENCE!

You will have start a new game for CAREER mode.....science is useless in sandbox

Weekly will most likely come between 10 and 12 for me, so in 2 to 4 hours.

And woop testing!! 0.22 incoming
For me it always comes about the time I'm driving home from work so everyone has already got all the news before me.

Yeah, me too Previous upgrades were out when i was at work, so i had to download late in the night. Which meant no playing until morning. And very bad download speed, since its afternoon in USA and a boatload of people is downloading the game at the same time

Well, speak of the devil.

That glorious, glorious tech tree.

So it looks like we start with a MK 1 Command pod, a lvt-45, RT-10 SRB, FLT-200, One of those modular girder thingys, a Antenna and a parachute.

To the VAB!!

You will have start a new game for CAREER mode.....science is useless in sandbox

actually editing the safe file from sandbox to career might also work... they are all text files after all.

So it looks like we start with a MK 1 Command pod, a lvt-45, RT-10 SRB, FLT-200, One of those modular girder thingys, a Antenna and a parachute.

To the VAB!!

sounds a little like

To the Batcave[, Robin]!

So it looks like we start with a MK 1 Command pod, a lvt-45, RT-10 SRB, FLT-200, One of those modular girder thingys, a Antenna and a parachute.

To the VAB!!

Remember, no decoupler in the first batch so you either launch suicidal missions or you leave them all in orbit until you get decouplers and a two-man capsule so you can rescue them.

Alternatively build some crazy contraption with those girders to manage many parachutes and then hope it doesn't tear itself apart when the parachute inflates.

SO we are looking at putting them in orbit indefinitely until we can mount rescue missions. Fun.

That OR sticking to sub orbital flights with small rockets so that the kerbals can actually live. I wonder, have they differenced teh LV-T30 and LV-T45 some to be more apart in .22 like mainsail and skipper or no?
No solar panels until tier 7 so LKO is going to be filled with spinning, dark chunks of metal filled with the dessicated corpses of once-brave kerbonauts.

it'll make for some interesting first missions, then again, there's no science part on this so i'm led to assume that it's not ALL we get, after all, we're gonna need some kind of science part to do science.
I would assume they have some sort of suborbital/get of the ground goal that would give you decouplers

Remember, no decoupler in the first batch so you either launch suicidal missions or you leave them all in orbit until you get decouplers and a two-man capsule so you can rescue them.

Alternatively build some crazy contraption with those girders to manage many parachutes and then hope it doesn't tear itself apart when the parachute inflates.

Very Kerbal approach - Jeb approved.

I'm rather disappointed that it looks like we'll be starting the campaign with manned missions right from the get-go. I would have very much liked to have seen incentive for sputnik style initial unmanned probes leading up to being able to research capsules (presumedly with life support) for your kerbals.

At present, it seems that probe cores are unlocked rather late in the tech tree, which strikes me as rather backwards, and which skips over a whole potentially interesting parallel to the history of space flight. I think it would be very cool if just getting an unmanned probe into the upper atmosphere was an achievement in the early game, and provided you with valuable initial research to get your space program rolling.

I think that it may also lead to a lot of oddities if you are initially limited to manned missions until you unlock probe cores, like sending manned missions to the Mun before probes. Honestly, I'm not even sure what unmanned probes would be used for if it's easier to perform manned missions.

Edited October 9, 2013 by FlowerChild

You will have start a new game for CAREER mode.....science is useless in sandbox

I guess you can still do science and gathering science points, just something more to do.

It will not count toward progress is career.

Remember, no decoupler in the first batch so you either launch suicidal missions or you leave them all in orbit until you get decouplers and a two-man capsule so you can rescue them.

Alternatively build some crazy contraption with those girders to manage many parachutes and then hope it doesn't tear itself apart when the parachute inflates.

Your rocket will also work as an crumble zone for the pod.

Without staging it will be hard to reach orbit anyway.

I'm rather disappointed that it looks like we'll be starting the campaign with manned missions right from the get-go. I would have very much liked to have seen incentive for sputnik style initial unmanned probes leading up to being able to research capsules (presumedly with life support) for your kerbals.

At present, it seems that probe cores are unlocked rather late in the tech tree, which strikes me as rather backwards, and which skips over a whole potentially interesting parallel to the history of space flight. I think it would be very cool if just getting an unmanned probe into the upper atmosphere was an achievement in the early game, and provided you with valuable initial research to get your space program rolling.

Agree here, and yes without staging most would not be able to get probes into orbit. You would not get the light probes early.
